history.content:
If you've taken ee151 or equivalent you might be able to help us design a CMOS chip for the the Space Sciences Laboratory.

They currently have an ion spectrometer flying on the Parker solar probe, and have a need for an updated version of one

of the chips in that instrument.  (Who wouldn't want to say "Hey mom, my summer project just launched for Mars!"?)

We are also looking for a student to work on the digital parts of our Single Chip micro Mote, the next version of which

will use a RISC-V instead of the current Cortex M0.

Analog IC projects are also available.

contact: pister@eecs.berkeley.edu
history.subject: undergrad research: CMOS for Space and IoT
